Training LLM Agents for Long-Horizon Tasks using Reinforcement Learning

üìù In Preparation 2024 +
Reinforcement Learning Large Language Models Multi-Agent Systems

Authors: Antonio Marino, Meta AI Team

Abstract: Current work at Meta focusing on training large language model agents for complex, long-horizon tasks using reinforcement learning techniques. Developing novel approaches for agent coordination and task decomposition.

Paper

Heterogeneous Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning with Graph Neural Networks

üèÜ ICML 2024 2024 +
Reinforcement Learning Multi-Agent Systems Graph Neural Networks

Authors: Antonio Marino, Amanda Prorok, et al.

Abstract: We propose a novel approach to multi-agent reinforcement learning that leverages graph neural networks to handle heterogeneous agent capabilities. Our method enables effective coordination among diverse agents with different observation and action spaces, leading to improved performance in complex multi-robot scenarios.

Paper Code Slides

BibTeX Citation:

@inproceedings{marino2024heterogeneous,
  title={Heterogeneous Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning with Graph Neural Networks},
  author={Marino, Antonio and Prorok, Amanda},
  booktitle={International Conference on Machine Learning},
  year={2024}
}

Multi-Agent Path Planning with Dynamic Obstacle Avoidance

üèÜ AAMAS 2023 2023 +
Optimization Multi-Agent Systems Robotics

Authors: Antonio Marino, Amanda Prorok

Abstract: We develop a novel approach for multi-agent path planning that dynamically adapts to changing environments and obstacle configurations. Our method combines optimization techniques with real-time replanning capabilities for robust robotic navigation.

Paper Code Video

BibTeX Citation:

@inproceedings{marino2023pathplanning,
  title={Multi-Agent Path Planning with Dynamic Obstacle Avoidance},
  author={Marino, Antonio and Prorok, Amanda},
  booktitle={International Conference on Autonomous Agents and Multiagent Systems},
  year={2023}
}

BenchMARL: A Benchmarking Suite for Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning

üë• NeurIPS 2023 Workshop 2023 +
Reinforcement Learning Multi-Agent Systems

Authors: Antonio Marino, Matteo Bettini, Vincent Moens

Abstract: BenchMARL provides a comprehensive benchmarking framework for multi-agent reinforcement learning algorithms. It standardizes evaluation protocols and provides fair comparisons across different MARL approaches, facilitating reproducible research in the field.

Paper Code Documentation

BibTeX Citation:

@inproceedings{marino2023benchmarl,

  author={Marino, Antonio and Bettini, Matteo and Moens, Vincent},
  booktitle={NeurIPS Workshop on Multi-Agent Learning},
  year={2023}
}

VMAS: A Vectorized Multi-Agent Simulator for Collective Robotics

üèÜ IROS 2023 2023 +
Multi-Agent Systems Simulation Reinforcement Learning

Authors: Antonio Marino, Matteo Bettini, Amanda Prorok

Abstract: We present VMAS, a high-performance vectorized simulator for multi-agent reinforcement learning research. VMAS enables parallel execution of thousands of environment instances, significantly accelerating training and evaluation of multi-agent algorithms in robotic scenarios.

Paper Code Demo

BibTeX Citation:

@inproceedings{marino2023vmas,
  title={VMAS: A Vectorized Multi-Agent Simulator for Collective Robotics},
  author={Marino, Antonio and Bettini, Matteo and Prorok, Amanda},
  booktitle={IEEE/RSJ International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems},
  year={2023}
}

Transport Network Design for Multi-Agent Routing

üéì Master's Thesis 2021 +
Optimization Multi-Agent Systems

Authors: Antonio Marino

Abstract: This thesis investigates optimization algorithms for transport network design in multi-agent routing scenarios. We develop methods to optimize network topology and routing strategies simultaneously, improving overall system efficiency and reducing congestion.

Thesis Slides
